1565430707_16joHUdKRd7Qfjp6fjTfHkaqwkrUh.body: According to the TOR configuration file that ships with ZeroNet, you run as a regular client. No forwarding is performed and no exit policy is set. This means the client will not help the network, but merely runs as a consumer.

1565466571_18YwqjZF3kZjfbWcsvyfzzL8okGn2.body: ROM files hosted inside a weird folder structure on a GoDaddy server that advertises a camera lens. Why do I get the feeling that the owner of this website has no idea that the files are there.

> [trevorlaneray](#comment_40_12eXcQ1ojAbyCoCcMQ3JAKi73wgcJrjow3): Something in the back of my mind is telling me this is an attempt to expose ZeroNet user IPs.

Doing illegal things (publishing roms) to get a few IP addresses sounds stupid. Especially because there's a button that copies all IPs of participating members of a site to the clipboard.

> [steeljacket](#comment_6_18YwqjZF3kZjfbWcsvyfzzL8okGn2DRW1a): Hey can we uuencode shit here? Can you post the popular pokemon ones?

No. There's a 50 KB limit. Even Gen1 will not fit if posted as raw bytes.

Here you go: https://www115.zippyshare.com/v/9vL2PL5t/file.html

1565525838_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: The primary problem is that if their clearnet site is unavailable, their zeronet site will also not work

1565629267_1KUSKrffaR1sfLwxZUXUPshLpKhh5.body:
> Does it mean that my IP address is actually broadcast when making requests on ZeroNet?

Sort of. Whenever you need a resource you have to get it from one of the connected peers. That peer now knows your interest in the material. You don't broadcast your IP when you request things. Your ZeroNet client will submit its IP to the public tracker servers. Any client can now ask these servers for the IP pool of a certain site. If your IP is in that pool it means you have content for that site you can distribute. It doesn't necessarily means that you are actually using the site yourself.

Once you have downloaded the resource, you no longer need to ask others. The primary problem is that right now I can probe each tracker for a questionable site and they deliver the IP list to me.

> Page response time is not limited by your connection speed

This is a lie. Only things that are cached are not limited. Other things, like content updates or you posting something are indeed limited by your connection speed.

1565801544_1A3LTcwaXGFQJb7KDN4rbgYzNFQdA.body: Not a 08chan user but open the sidebar menu when the error message is shown (drag the zeronet icon to the left) and click the "Rebuild" button next to the database field. Maybe this helps

1566311383_18Edrkj8iAk85SHumkmNtHhJpALzk.body: Check out how TOR and Bittorrent DHT works. They are the two common methods of getting around.
